Description: Egyptian terracotta female figure mould-made, solid, with flat back. Head only.White coating preserved on some areas. Orange-brown fabric with grey core. Abundant fine silver mica, common quartz and rare white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

'20' written on back in pencil. Late 3rd to early 2nd century BC parallels have very similar hair style (Fischer 1994, pl.14, no.161), suggesting a Ptolemaic date. Fischer, J. 1994. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber. Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen. Tübingen, Wasmuth.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.447) (Phase 1)
